Description: Body fragment of Attic black-figured pottery closed vase, probably amphora. A warrior and an archer, side-by-side, to left; remaining are their thighs and the shield of a warrior (device, in white, a leg; added red on rim).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Almost certainly from the same vase as the fragment Heidelberg J 75 (CVA Germany 31: pl.165 fig.14), which shows a warrior to left, the device on his shield also a leg.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 75, no. 249 pl. 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0892)
